intro: Pfaffia gnaphalioides, commonly known as holy weed, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and has small, alternate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are usually yellow to brown in color and are arranged in clusters. Pfaffia gnaphalioides is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
